channel.title: Global Travel Brief
channel.itunes:author: Samony
channel.itunes:summary: Global Travel Brief delivers clear travel updates from major destinations worldwide. You get practical insight on entry rules, visa changes, flight trends, safety updates, and travel costs. Each episode explains factors shaping planning, timing, and budget. Coverage spans tourism hotspots, emerging destinations, airlines, airports, and travel policy. Information stays current and actionable. Global Travel Brief fits travelers, digital nomads, business travelers, and planners seeking clarity before booking. Follow Global Travel Brief. Travel informed. Travel smarter.
channel.itunes:keywords: nnpc, escravos-lagos gas pipeline, explosion, energy crisis, nigeria, infrastructure, government accountability, nigerian exchange, ngx, equity market, stock market, investment

item.title: NNPC Pipeline Explodes: Energy Crisis Deepens!
item.description:
The Host reports on a confirmed explosion at the Escravos-Lagos gas pipeline on December 10, expressing frustration and demanding accountability and swift action from authorities regarding the critical disruption to Nigeria's gas and power supply.
Hosts: Host: Collins the Ajebo
Category: sunrise brief

item.title: Nigerian Equity Market Explodes! N694 Billion Gain, Insurance Stocks Soar!
item.description:
The Nigerian Exchange saw a robust rebound, gaining N694 billion, fueled by returning investors. Insurance stocks significantly outperformed banking equities, driven by increased retail interest in lower-priced securities, marking a high-energy close to the trading week.
Hosts: Host: Omolara
Category: sunrise brief
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25

item.title: Dangote's Double Whammy: N699 Petrol and Dollar Dividends!
item.description:
Dangote Refinery has reduced petrol prices to N699 per litre. Additionally, the company plans to list a 10% stake on the Nigerian Exchange (NGX) and offer dividends in US Dollars, signaling a major economic development.
Hosts: Host: Kingsley
Category: sunrise brief
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25
